meanings.definition: Braggest (verb): to boast or talk with excessive pride
meanings.sent1: He always braggest about his accomplishments to everyone he meets.
meanings.sent2: She braggest so much that no one believes her stories anymore.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to braggest like its owner, much to the amusement of the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her car would braggest if it could talk, as it has been to so many exotic places.
meanings.sent5: The little boy would braggest about his toy collection, making sure everyone knew how special it was.

meanings.definition: Braggest (adjective): superlative form of brag, indicating the most boastful or prideful
meanings.sent1: She was the braggest student in the class, always talking about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: The braggest person at the party was the one wearing the most extravagant outfit.
meanings.sent3: The braggest cake at the bake sale was decorated with edible gold flakes.
meanings.sent4: Her braggest smile lit up the room, showing how proud she was of her accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The braggest tree in the forest stood tall and proud, overshadowing all the others with its grandeur.

meanings.definition: Braggest (noun): a person who boasts or brags excessively
meanings.sent1: He was known as the braggest in town, always talking about his possessions.
meanings.sent2: The braggest in the office would often interrupt others to talk about their achievements.
meanings.sent3: The braggest at the party was the center of attention, entertaining everyone with their stories.
meanings.sent4: She avoided sitting next to the braggest at dinner, as she didn't want to hear constant boasting.
meanings.sent5: The braggest in the family always made sure to be the loudest voice in the room, seeking attention.
